trans-unit.source: Returns extended information about a specific network provider

seg-source.mrk: Returns extended information about a specific network provider

target.mrk: Returns extended information about a specific network provider

trans-unit.source: The network provider for which information is required

seg-source.mrk: The network provider for which information is required

target.mrk: The network provider for which information is required

trans-unit.source: an array with the following format:

seg-source.mrk: an array with the following format:

target.mrk: an array with the following format:

trans-unit.source: $aInfo[0] - Version number of the network provider software

seg-source.mrk: $aInfo[0] - Version number of the network provider software

target.mrk: $aInfo[0] - Version number of the network provider software

trans-unit.source: $aInfo[1] - Current status of the network provider software:

seg-source.mrk: $aInfo[1] - Current status of the network provider software:

target.mrk: $aInfo[1] - Current status of the network provider software:

trans-unit.source: 2 - The network is not currently able to service requests

seg-source.mrk: 2 - The network is not currently able to service requests

target.mrk: 2 - The network is not currently able to service requests

trans-unit.source: $aInfo[2] - Instance handle for the network provider

seg-source.mrk: $aInfo[2] - Instance handle for the network provider

target.mrk: $aInfo[2] - Instance handle for the network provider

trans-unit.source: $aInfo[3] - High word of the network type unique to the running network

seg-source.mrk: $aInfo[3] - High word of the network type unique to the running network

target.mrk: $aInfo[3] - High word of the network type unique to the running network

trans-unit.source: $aInfo[4] - Set of bit flags indicating the valid print numbers for redirecting local printer devices, with the low-order bit corresponding to LPT1.

seg-source.mrk: $aInfo[4] - Set of bit flags indicating the valid print numbers for redirecting local printer devices, with the low-order bit corresponding to LPT1.

target.mrk: $aInfo[4] - Set of bit flags indicating the valid print numbers for redirecting local printer devices, with the low-order bit corresponding to LPT1.

trans-unit.source: $aInfo[5] - Set of bit flags indicating the valid local disk devices that can be used for redirecting disk drives, with the low-order bit corresponding to A:.

seg-source.mrk: $aInfo[5] - Set of bit flags indicating the valid local disk devices that can be used for redirecting disk drives, with the low-order bit corresponding to A:.

target.mrk: $aInfo[5] - Set of bit flags indicating the valid local disk devices that can be used for redirecting disk drives, with the low-order bit corresponding to A:.
